bullets.text: Machine learning teaches computers to learn from data.
It replaces explicit programming rules with data-driven learning.
Systems are trained using labeled datasets.
Example: Classifying emails as spam or not spam.
Common algorithms include decision trees, support vector machines, and neural networks.
Systems identify patterns in data without explicit labels.
Example: Grouping customers based on purchasing behavior.
K-means is a classic unsupervised learning algorithm.
An agent learns by interacting with an environment and receiving feedback or rewards.
Examples: Training AI for video games or robot control.
Overfitting: Model memorizes training data, performing poorly on new data.
Bias: Occurs when training data is unbalanced or unrepresentative.
Automotive: Essential for object recognition in self-driving cars.
